com.googlecode.biscotti.base

Class Preconditions2

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.biscotti.base.Preconditions2

  • public final class Preconditions2
extends java.lang.Object
    Static utility methods used to verify correctness of arguments passed to your own methods.
    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov
    See Also:
    Preconditions

    • Method Detail

      • checkArgumentNotNull

        public static <T> T checkArgumentNotNull(T arg)
        Ensures that an argument passed as a parameter to the calling method is not null.

        Unlike Preconditions.checkNotNull(T) this method throws an IllegalArgumentException instead of a NullPointerException if the arg parameter is null.

        Parameters:
        arg - the argument passed to the calling method
        Returns:
        the non-null argument that was validated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null

      • checkArgumentNotNull

        public static <T> T checkArgumentNotNull(T arg,
                         java.lang.Object message)
        Ensures that an argument passed as a parameter to the calling method is not null.

        Unlike Preconditions.checkNotNull(T, Object) this method throws an IllegalArgumentException instead of a NullPointerException if the arg parameter is null.

        Parameters:
        arg - the argument passed to the calling method
        message - the exception message to use if the check fails; will be converted to a string using String.valueOf(Object)
        Returns:
        the non-null argument that was validated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null

      • checkArgumentNotNull

        public static <T> T checkArgumentNotNull(T arg,
                         java.lang.String template,
                         java.lang.Object... messages)
        Ensures that an argument passed as a parameter to the calling method is not null.

        Unlike Preconditions.checkNotNull(T, String, Object...) this method throws an IllegalArgumentException instead of a NullPointerException if the arg parameter is null.

        Parameters:
        arg - the argument passed to the calling method
        template - a template for the exception message should the check fail. The message is formed by replacing each %s placeholder in the template with an argument. These are matched by position - the first %s gets errorMessageArgs[0], etc. Unmatched arguments will be appended to the formatted message in square braces. Unmatched placeholders will be left as-is.
        messages - the arguments to be substituted into the message template. Arguments are converted to strings using String.valueOf(Object).
        Returns:
        the non-null argument that was validated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is null
